title: Turkish fixes:
message:
Turkish fixes:
i) Replace "betik" with "kitap". There was a partial patch in 83860a4cefc14878, this commit replaces all occurrences.
Using "betik" instead of kitap is an esoteric attempt to remove the arabic loan word "kitap" and use the pure Turkish word "betik" instead.
"betik" technically means any written document but never used in place of "kitap" in modern Turkish.
It comes from the ancient Turkish word "bitig" (written documents, books, etc).
"betik" has a place in modern Turkish as a translation for "script".

ii) Remove the esoteric "Tor beti" with "Ağ sayfası" (web page).
"sayfa" is again an arabic load word, although "ağ" is Turkish, however "tor" is used by other Turkic nations, although not Turkey.
"bet" is coming from the "bitig" root "bit(i)" (see above).
Almost 99.99% of the Turks won't have a clue about "tor beti" which is again an attempt
to replace the loan words (actually just the "web" part) with pure Turkish (and a bit invented) words.

message:
Be a little more careful about negation in search strings

"foo-bar" will now search for "foo bar" (meaning "foo AND bar")
"foo -bar" will now search for "foo -bar" (meaning "foo AND NOT bar")

This problem was highlighted by titles with hypenated words, like

dame". We now allow negation, but only if preceded by a space (or at
start).

title: Bug fix for Android 2.1 and double-dereferencing SQLiteDatabase objects
message:
Bug fix for Android 2.1 and double-dereferencing SQLiteDatabase objects

There seems to be a subtle bug in Android 2.1 that results in the
reference count of SQLiteDatabase objects being decremented too many
times.

The simplest way to see this is to:

- comment out the onPause() code in BookEdit
- start the app
- go to "My Books"
- click on a book
- press 'back' until you get back to MainMenu
- select "Ny Books" 

This will crash in Android 2.1 with an "already closed" message on the
database (an SQLiteClosable).

There may well be other similar sources of this problem.

A more drastic solution would be to call acquireReference() on the
database 100 times, then use reflection to make sure the number never
drops below 100...but it's probably best to avoid such techniques.

With luck, we can just discontinue support for Android 2.1 Soon(tm).

previously mean that the onPause() would be fired before the list had
build, and the wrong expansion settings would be saved.

is only saved if the list has been built once.

Fix for Issue 214; work-around for probable bug in Honeycomb.

It seems that Honeycomb releases cursors in Activitiy objects which
have been passed to startManagingObjects() but the underlying users of
those cursors (eg. intrinsic Android adapters) do not expect them to
be deleted.

This patch replaces startManagingCursor() functionality.

Unfortunately Google have not released Android 3.0 source yet, so it
is hard to tell the cause.

The big changes here are:

- progress dialog when looking up ISBN (and using AsyncTask).
- work flow change -- scanning a book or entering an ISBN goes
straight back to the scanner or data entry screen. This more closely
represents my work pattern, but may not be generally true.

Source code changes:

BookCatalogue:

1. Changed OnGroupClickListener to OnGroupExpandListener because both
Click and Collapse were firing on a collapse, making the lists get out
of sync.
2. Replaced addToCurrentGroup with adjustCurrentGroup to more reliably
track group open/close.
3. revised createBookScan so that it calls BookISBNSearch to manage
the barcode scanning.

BookISBNSearch:

1. Now uses ProgressDialog. Removed mIsbnStatus and related dialog
field. 
2. Added code to support scanning barcodes from this activity.
3. Added a SearchForBookTask class based on AsyncTask to do ISBN
lookups.

CatalogueDBAdapter:

1. Added some CAse Insensitive indices (suffix _ci). Possibly need to
add more. Note that COLLATE NOCASE does not work with Unicode (I
believe).
2. Modified fetchAuthorPositionByName to use case insentitive matchh
and order so position is correct when comparing 'de Camp' with
'Zelazny'.
